meanings.definition: A person or thing that opposes or is against life.
meanings.sent1: The antilifer protested against the construction of the new factory near the wildlife sanctuary.
meanings.sent2: The scientist believed the virus was an antilifer, threatening the existence of the endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The antilifer squirrel kept stealing the bird's food, causing chaos in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her negative attitude was like an antilifer, draining the joy out of every situation.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the story was portrayed as an antilifer, seeking to destroy all that was good and pure.

meanings.definition: A substance or treatment that inhibits or prevents the growth or reproduction of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The antilifer spray was used in the garden to control the pesky insect population.
meanings.sent2: The medication acted as an antilifer, stopping the spread of harmful bacteria in the body.
meanings.sent3: The antilifer potion accidentally turned the flowers into miniature trees, creating a magical garden.
meanings.sent4: The antilifer solution worked like a shield, protecting the plants from harmful pests.
meanings.sent5: The antilifer treatment was so effective that the invasive species could no longer thrive in the ecosystem.
